Need I even explain? Shameless cashgrab shell of a former great game. 
[list]
[*]They do away with lootboxes that allowed players to get cosmetics for free in a game they paid for. 
[*]They insert real world politics and drama into their game and uselessly censor their game and split the playerbases.
[*]Renaming of Jesse McCree simply because of [i]alleged[/i] things a real person that shared his name did. The name McCree itself has ties to westerns already, like Mad Dog McCree. They remove a noose spray for the western cowboy character and their reasoning is "because it's racist, reee!" 
[*]Their initial promise for Overwatch 2 was simply a pve story expansion with an new engine. It was to be a separate game that allowed for PvP crossplay with the first game. All new heroes would still be available to users of the first game. And users of the first game would keep their account progression and cosmetics in the second game. That's what they promised for their hope of "redefining what it means to be a sequel."
See 16:55 onward for the talk on Overwatch 2.
https://youtu.be/aM1oKTw83ao?t=1015 
[/list]
They redefined it alright. They ended up removing more things than they added. This is essentially Overwatch 0.5.
Things they removed/changed:
[list]
[*]Account level border progression. All the playtime you accrued in Overwatch showed in your player border portrait. bronze up to level 600, silver to 1200, gold to 1800, platinum to 2400, and diamond onward. They removed this for seemingly no reason. My guess is it was an effort to "combat toxicity" from players that mock others for being in a low competitive rank in comparison to their overall level. "Gold border gold, gold border plat" etc. A total joke.
[*]They also over simplified the HUD and UI of the game. If you look at footage from Overwatch 1's beta, there is little difference in how it looks. 
[*]There has been a bastion victory pose that has been removed from the game (even if you owned it) since overwatch 2's release and has yet to be added back. The pose is Bastion's Medal pose from Summer Games.
[*]They removed end of round accolades with the vote cards. 
[*]They removed the on-fire system (added it back in season 4 or 5 but worse than it was originally). When they returned it, the voice lines could be heard from every person on your team, very loudly and much too often. 
[*]They removed the medal system that showed how you were performing within your own team. For stats for damage, eliminations, assists, objective time, and healing, you could see gold, silver, bronze, or no medal to indicate if you were the best, second best, third best, etc on your team in that category. They seemingly removed them to prevent toxicity by players exclaiming "I have gold damage" as a way to say that they were the best and the rest of the team is bad. 
But in a 9000 IQ move by blizzard, they remove the medals. And in their place, they adopted the extremely minimalist scoreboard they have now, allowing every player in the game to view every one else's exact stats. Yup. Before, you could only see your own stats. Now you can see everyone's exact numbers. This way, you can choose your harassment targets more accurately. 
[*]They removed all overwatch league team skins from being obtainable in the shop. Why? They wanted people to buy their Overwatch 2 versions instead. Instead of making both available, they announce removal of the Overwatch 1 versions to induce FOMO.
[*]They removed the general chat for talking to random players in the menu.
[*]They removed the in-game looking for group system, forcing players to resort to outside methods like discord servers to find groups to play with.
[*]They removed the Assault (2cp, 2 capture point) game mode and maps from Quick Play and Competitive. (minimal player complaints instead of addressing and fixing problems with those maps, they remove them alltogether.)
You can still play the mode and maps in custom games, and once every 2 weeks when the mode appears in arcade for 1 day. They replace it with Push, a mode that the players could not give feedback on before it hit competitive play. It is very unpopular and lasts a very long time. They are releasing a new "core" game mode (it will be in competitive) called flashpoint, which suffers the same long game times as push, with the added bonus of nobody ever being able to group up due to the sheer size of the maps.
[*]More that I can't remember due to how long ago it seems.
[/list]
Separate section for lootboxes:
[list]
[*]They removed lootboxes because of player and supposed region complains on gambling. However, the lootbox system was incredibly generous. After sometime around 2017 or 2018, they changed the system so that players were guaranteed to obtain an item they did not yet own. If you owned every item in a category (common, rare, epic, legendary) you would receive coins for a duplicate. 
[*]The only rng was which rarity of item you obtained. If you had all legendary event skins except for one, the next legendary drop you got would be guaranteed to be that skin, or 500 coins which could still be used to buy the skin. 3000 for a skin that released that year, 1000 if you buy it next year.
[*]These lootboxes could be obtained by leveling up every 20,000 exp (Finishing a qp match generally gave you 6000 exp, and a comp match could go up to 15,000). To put that into perspective, Overwatch 2 levels up every 10,000 exp, but you only gain 800-1200 for finishing a match. 
[*]Each lootbox gave you four items. There was options to buy lootboxes so you could obtain them faster if you didn't want to grind. That kind of system exists in almost every game. Pay to skip grind, and theres nothing wrong with that.
[/list]
Their payment model now:
[list]
[*]Game is free, and has moved to an in game shop + battle pass business model. They want to be like fortnite and every other game with a battle pass.
[*]They split their main in-game currency into two categories: the free legacy credits (credits obtained in overwatch 1 from dupes), and the new premium credits (coins, obtained only from purchases or weekly challenges)
[*] The cheapest way to obtain the battle pass is with $10 USD or 1000 premium currency. They also include it in bundles that go from $20-$40 USD, locking skins that were themed to that current season behind those paid bundles (and have yet to ever return)
[*]You can only get 60 premium coins per week by completing every weekly challenge. Since seasons generally last 2-3 months, you can only get 480-720 coins per season. Not enough to buy a battle pass, let alone if you ever wanted to get a new shop skin which go from 1700-2300 or more.
[*]They do not have premium currency obtainable in the battle pass, and instead it is flooded with useless cosmetics nobody ever uses like souvenirs, and random sprays and icons the vast majority of players will never use. 
[*]They put skins in the battle pass that have no relation to the seasonal theme, and put 2-4 skins that do have relation to the season in the shop, locked behind 2000 premium coins ($20 USD) or bundles that cost $10-$40 USD. 
[*]They expressed wanting to bring back past battle pass cosmetics for players to obtain. This way they take advantage of the FOMO for people buying them in the first place, and can double dip by having people buy them again later.
[*]In overwatch 1, there were weekly challenges during events like Halloween, Summer games, Christmas etc. A total of three weekly challenges that rewarded players with legacy skins that could only be obtained that week. They included flavor text saying "Unlocked by participating in the ... 20XX week X challenge."
Since Overwatch 2, those skins could not be viewable in the hero gallery if you did not already own them. Now they put them in the shop for 1700 premium coins and remove the text that says they were obtainable in a 20XX event. 
[/list]
And I have just learned there is a character limit to steam reviews.

Just here to reinforce the overwhelmingly negative reviews
this game azz, overwatch 1 was ballin

https://www.reddit.com/r/Overwatch/comments/15o1yk3/steam_dlc_fix/

THIS REDDIT POST FIXED THE STEAM DLC BUG! 

I bought the invasion bundle on steam but my 1000 coins and story missions didn't appear in OW2.

THE FIX: Launch the game from Battle.net launcher, then close it, then launch from Steam, and voila, this small indie studio's DLC will appear. Both my 1000 OW coins and story missions were available.
